Module 2: Hands-on with pharmacogenomics data

Jermiah J. Joseph

Princess Margaret Cancer Centre
jermiah.joseph@uhn.ca

1 October 2024

module2.Rmd

Lab 2 Overview

Instructor(s) name(s) and contact information

  • Jermiah J. Joseph jermiah.joseph@uhn.ca
  • ALMAS_ DETAILS

Lab Description

Learning goals

  • Understand the data structure of a PharmacoSet
  • Learn how to access features and metadata from a PharmacoSet
  • Learn how to plot batch effects using PCA and run correction method (SVA)
  • Learn how to filter out outliers and missing values

Learning objectives

  • Describe the use cases for PharmacoGx in Pharmacogenomics
  • Understand the structure of the CoreSet and PharmacoSet classes to facilitate their use in subsequent analyses
  • Download/load a PharmacoSet using PharmacoGx or orcestra.ca
  • Subset and filter a PharmacoSet by samples and/or treatments
  • Access the molecular features, dose-response and metadata contained within the PharmacoSet

Getting Started

Use Cases for PharmacoGx

*Downloading Data from orcestra.ca

available <- PharmacoGx::availablePSets() |> 
  data.table::as.data.table()

print(names(available))
#> [1] "Dataset Name" "Date Created" "PSet Name"    "version"      "type"        
#> [6] "publication"  "DOI"          "Download"

print(available[, c("Dataset Name", "PSet Name", "version") ])
#>     Dataset Name         PSet Name      version
#>           <char>            <char>       <char>
#>  1:         GDSC GDSC_2020(v2-8.2) 2020(v2-8.2)
#>  2:         FIMM         FIMM_2016         2016
#>  3:        Tavor        Tavor_2020         2020
#>  4:        NCI60        NCI60_2021         2021
#>  5:    UHNBreast    UHNBreast_2019         2019
#>  6:         GDSC GDSC_2020(v1-8.2) 2020(v1-8.2)
#>  7:        PRISM        PRISM_2020         2020
#>  8:      BeatAML      BeatAML_2018         2018
#>  9:         gCSI         gCSI_2019         2019
#> 10:       CTRPv2       CTRPv2_2015         2015
#> 11:         GRAY         GRAY_2017         2017
#> 12:         CCLE         CCLE_2015         2015
#> 13:         PDTX         PDTX_2019         2019
#> 14:          GBM          GBM_scr2         2021
#> 15:          GBM          GBM_scr3         2021
#> 16:   NCISarcoma   NCISarcoma_2015         2015

The following function from PharmacoGx can be used to download any of the available PSets from orcestra.ca

# this markdown will not run the command as download can take up to 10 minutes
# PharmacoGx::downloadPSet(name="CCLE_2015",saveDir = "../psets", timeout = 3600, verbose = T)

For convenience, we have created a PharmacoSet to be used in this tutorial. We will be interacting with this dataset for the remainder of the tutorial.

data(NCI_ALMANAC_2017)
NCI_ALMANAC_2017
#> <PharmacoSet>
#> Name: NCI_ALMANAC_2017 
#> Date Created: Tue Oct  1 15:34:48 2024 
#> Number of samples:  60 
#> Molecular profiles: <MultiAssayExperiment>

#>     [1] rna : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 54609 rows and 59 columns 
#>     [2] mirna : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 417 rows and 59 columns 
#>     [3] rnaseq.comp : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 23808 rows and 59 columns 
#>     [4] rnaseq.iso : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 23808 rows and 59 columns

#>    dim:  10080 62

#>    colData(6): sampleid bio_rep CELLNAME CELLNBR PANEL PANELNBR 
#>    metadata(1): experiment_metadata

Understanding the Data Structure

The PharmacoSet class is a container for pharmacogenomic data.

This pharmacogenomic data is typically generated from high-throughput screening experiments where cell lines are treated with a panel of drugs at multiple doses and the response is measured using a molecular assay.

slotNames(NCI_ALMANAC_2017)
#> [1] "treatmentResponse" "annotation"        "molecularProfiles"
#> [4] "sample"            "treatment"         "datasetType"      
#> [7] "perturbation"      "curation"

View the samples

We can access the sampleNames of the PharmacoSet:

PharmacoGx::sampleNames(NCI_ALMANAC_2017)
#>  [1] "786-O"       "A-498"       "A-549"       "ACHN"        "BT-549"     
#>  [6] "CCRF-CEM"    "COLO 205"    "Caki-1"      "DU145"       "EKVX"       
#> [11] "HCC2998"     "HCT 116"     "HCT 15"      "HL-60(TB)"   "HOP-62"     
#> [16] "HOP-92"      "HT-29"       "Hs 578T"     "IGROV-1"     "K-562"      
#> [21] "KM12"        "LOX-IMVI"    "M14"         "MCF-7"       "MDA-MB-231" 
#> [26] "MDA-MB-435"  "MDA-MB-468"  "MOLT-4"      "Malme-3M"    "NCI-ADR-RES"
#> [31] "NCI-H226"    "NCI-H23"     "NCI-H322M"   "NCI-H460"    "NCI-H522"   
#> [36] "OVCAR-3"     "OVCAR-4"     "OVCAR-5"     "OVCAR-8"     "PC-3"       
#> [41] "RPMI-8226"   "RXF 393L"    "SF268"       "SF295"       "SF539"      
#> [46] "SK-MEL-2"    "SK-MEL-28"   "SK-MEL-5"    "SK-OV-3"     "SN12C"      
#> [51] "SNB-19"      "SNB-75"      "SR"          "SW620"       "T-47D"      
#> [56] "TK-10"       "U-251MG"     "UACC-257"    "UACC-62"     "UO-31"

To get all the metadata associated with the samples, we can access the sample slot:

NCI_ALMANAC_2017@sample |> str()
#> 'data.frame':    60 obs. of  7 variables:
#>  $ sampleid            : chr  "786-O" "A-498" "A-549" "ACHN" ...
#>  $ tissueid            : chr  "Kidney" "Kidney" "Lung" "Kidney" ...
#>  $ cellosaurus_disease : chr  "Renal cell carcinoma" "Renal cell carcinoma" "Lung adenocarcinoma" "Papillary renal cell carcinoma" ...
#>  $ cellosaurus_id      : chr  "CVCL_1051" "CVCL_1056" "CVCL_0023" "CVCL_1067" ...
#>  $ NCI_ALMANAC.sampleid: chr  "786-0" "A498" "A549/ATCC" "ACHN" ...
#>  $ NCI_ALMANAC.disease : chr  "Renal Cancer" "Renal Cancer" "Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer" "Renal Cancer" ...
#>  $ pharmacodb_cid      : chr  "7860_28_2019" "A498_47_2019" "A549_48_2019" "ACHN_54_2019" ...

We can see from the sample slot that there are 60 samples in this PharmacoSet.

View the treatments

Similar to the samples, we can access the treatmentNames of the PharmacoSet:

PharmacoGx::treatmentNames(NCI_ALMANAC_2017) |> head()
#> [1] "Pralatrexate"                        
#> [2] "1,3-Bis(2-chloroethyl)-1-nitrosourea"
#> [3] "Ixabepilone"                         
#> [4] "Clofarabine"                         
#> [5] "Dasatinib"                           
#> [6] "Vincristine"

To get all the metadata associated with the treatments, we can access the treatment slot:

NCI_ALMANAC_2017@treatment |> str()
#> 'data.frame':    31 obs. of  5 variables:
#>  $ treatmentid            : chr  "Pralatrexate" "1,3-Bis(2-chloroethyl)-1-nitrosourea" "Ixabepilone" "Clofarabine" ...
#>  $ NCI_ALMANAC.treatmentid: chr  "pralatrexate" "Carmustine" "Ixabepilone" "Clofarabine" ...
#>  $ cid                    : int  148121 2578 6445540 119182 3062316 5978 457193 57469 36314 13342 ...
#>  $ smiles                 : chr  "C#CCC(CC1=CN=C2C(=N1)C(=NC(=N2)N)N)C3=CC=C(C=C3)C(=O)NC(CCC(=O)O)C(=O)O" "C(CCl)NC(=O)N(CCCl)N=O" "CC1CCCC2(C(O2)CC(NC(=O)CC(C(C(=O)C(C1O)C)(C)C)O)C(=CC3=CSC(=N3)C)C)C" "Nc1nc(Cl)nc2n(cnc12)C3OC(CO)C(O)C3F" ...
#>  $ inchikey               : chr  "OGSBUKJUDHAQEA-WMCAAGNKSA-N" "DLGOEMSEDOSKAD-UHFFFAOYSA-N" "FABUFPQFXZVHFB-PVYNADRNSA-N" "WDDPHFBMKLOVOX-UHFFFAOYSA-N" ...

There are also 31 treatments used.

Subset by sampleNames and/or treatmentNames 

PharmacoGx::subsetBySample(
  NCI_ALMANAC_2017, 
  sample = sampleNames(NCI_ALMANAC_2017)[1:5]
)
#> <PharmacoSet>
#> Name: NCI_ALMANAC_2017 
#> Date Created: Tue Oct  1 15:34:48 2024 
#> Number of samples:  5 
#> Molecular profiles: <MultiAssayExperiment> 
#>    ExperimentList class object of length 4: 
#>     [1] rna : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 54609 rows and 5 columns 
#>     [2] mirna : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 417 rows and 5 columns 
#>     [3] rnaseq.comp : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 23808 rows and 5 columns 
#>     [4] rnaseq.iso : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 23808 rows and 5 columns 
#> Treatment response: <TreatmentResponseExperiment> 
#>    dim:  9352 5 
#>    assays(3): response profiles assay_metadata 
#>    rownames(9352): 1,3-Bis(2-chloroethyl)-1-nitrosourea::0.05:NA:1 1,3-Bis(2-chloroethyl)-1-nitrosourea::0.15:NA:1 ... Vorinostat:Vincristine:1:0.01:1 Vorinostat:Vincristine:1:0.1:1 
#>    rowData(9): treatment1id treatment2id treatment1dose ... CONC2 NSC2 CONCINDEX2 
#>    colnames(5): 786-O:1 A-498:1 A-549:1 ACHN:1 BT-549:1 
#>    colData(6): sampleid bio_rep CELLNAME CELLNBR PANEL PANELNBR 
#>    metadata(1): experiment_metadata

PharmacoGx::subsetByTreatment(
  NCI_ALMANAC_2017, 
  treatment = treatmentNames(NCI_ALMANAC_2017)[1:5]
)

#> Date Created: Tue Oct  1 15:34:48 2024

#>     [3] rnaseq.comp : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 23808 rows and 59 columns

Subsetting using sample and treatment metadata 

unique(NCI_ALMANAC_2017@sample$tissueid)
#>  [1] "Kidney"               "Lung"                 "Breast"              
#>  [4] "Lymphoid"             "Bowel"                "Prostate"            
#>  [7] "Myeloid"              "Ovary/Fallopian Tube" "Skin"                
#> [10] "Pleura"               "CNS/Brain"

tissues_of_interest <- c("Kidney")
indices  <- which(NCI_ALMANAC_2017@sample$tissueid %in% tissues_of_interest)


(samples_of_interest <- sampleNames(NCI_ALMANAC_2017)[indices])
#> [1] "786-O"    "A-498"    "ACHN"     "Caki-1"   "RXF 393L" "SN12C"    "TK-10"   
#> [8] "UO-31"

PharmacoGx::subsetBySample(
  NCI_ALMANAC_2017, 
  sample = samples_of_interest
)
#> <PharmacoSet>
#> Name: NCI_ALMANAC_2017 
#> Date Created: Tue Oct  1 15:34:48 2024 
#> Number of samples:  8 
#> Molecular profiles: <MultiAssayExperiment> 
#>    ExperimentList class object of length 4: 
#>     [1] rna : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 54609 rows and 8 columns 
#>     [2] mirna : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 417 rows and 8 columns 
#>     [3] rnaseq.comp : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 23808 rows and 8 columns 
#>     [4] rnaseq.iso : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 23808 rows and 8 columns 
#> Treatment response: <TreatmentResponseExperiment> 
#>    dim:  9436 8 
#>    assays(3): response profiles assay_metadata 
#>    rownames(9436): 1,3-Bis(2-chloroethyl)-1-nitrosourea::0.05:NA:1 1,3-Bis(2-chloroethyl)-1-nitrosourea::0.15:NA:1 ... Vorinostat:Vincristine:1:0.01:1 Vorinostat:Vincristine:1:0.1:1 
#>    rowData(9): treatment1id treatment2id treatment1dose ... CONC2 NSC2 CONCINDEX2 
#>    colnames(8): 786-O:1 A-498:1 ACHN:1 ... SN12C:1 TK-10:1 UO-31:1 
#>    colData(6): sampleid bio_rep CELLNAME CELLNBR PANEL PANELNBR 
#>    metadata(1): experiment_metadata

A concise way to subset by sample in one step:


PharmacoGx::subsetBySample(
  NCI_ALMANAC_2017, 
  sample = NCI_ALMANAC_2017@sample[
    NCI_ALMANAC_2017@sample$tissueid == "Kidney", 
    "sampleid"
  ]
)
#> <PharmacoSet>
#> Name: NCI_ALMANAC_2017 
#> Date Created: Tue Oct  1 15:34:48 2024 
#> Number of samples:  8 
#> Molecular profiles: <MultiAssayExperiment> 
#>    ExperimentList class object of length 4: 
#>     [1] rna : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 54609 rows and 8 columns 
#>     [2] mirna : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 417 rows and 8 columns 
#>     [3] rnaseq.comp : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 23808 rows and 8 columns 
#>     [4] rnaseq.iso : RangedSummarizedExperiment with 23808 rows and 8 columns 
#> Treatment response: <TreatmentResponseExperiment> 
#>    dim:  9436 8 
#>    assays(3): response profiles assay_metadata 
#>    rownames(9436): 1,3-Bis(2-chloroethyl)-1-nitrosourea::0.05:NA:1 1,3-Bis(2-chloroethyl)-1-nitrosourea::0.15:NA:1 ... Vorinostat:Vincristine:1:0.01:1 Vorinostat:Vincristine:1:0.1:1 
#>    rowData(9): treatment1id treatment2id treatment1dose ... CONC2 NSC2 CONCINDEX2 
#>    colnames(8): 786-O:1 A-498:1 ACHN:1 ... SN12C:1 TK-10:1 UO-31:1 
#>    colData(6): sampleid bio_rep CELLNAME CELLNBR PANEL PANELNBR 
#>    metadata(1): experiment_metadata
